title: An R package for Statistical Coefficient Significativity
Cohen's \(\kappa\) — Cohen's kappa
code: # create a confusion matrix conf_matrix <- matrix(1:9, nrow = 3, ncol = 3)  # evaluate Cohen's kappa of `conf_matrix` cohen_kappa(conf_matrix) #> [1] -0.04166667

title: Information Agreement — Information Agreement
text: method computes Information Agreement \(\text{IA}\) confusion matrix.

title: Information Agreement — Information Agreement
code: # create a confusion matrix conf_matrix <- matrix(1:9, nrow = 3, ncol = 3)  # evaluate the Information Agreement of `conf_matrix` IA(conf_matrix) #> [1] 0.005631984

title: Scott's \(\pi\) — Scott's pi
code: # create a confusion matrix conf_matrix <- matrix(1:9, nrow = 3, ncol = 3)  # evaluate Scott's pi of `conf_matrix` scott_pi(conf_matrix) #> [1] -0.05633803

title: The \(\sigma\)-significativity of \(c\) — significativity
text: function evaluates significativity \(\sigma\)-value either \(\mathcal{M}_{n,m}\) \(\mathcal{P}_{n}\) depending call parameters. m natural number, \(\sigma\)-significativity \(c\) \(\mathcal{M}_{n,m}\) evaluated. number_of_samples natural number, significativity estimated using Monte Carlo method. Otherwise, computation considers \(n \times n\)-confusion matrices. instead m set NULL, function uses Monte Carlo method estimate \(\sigma\)-significativity \(c\) \(\mathcal{P}_{n}\).

title: The \(\sigma\)-significativity of \(c\) — significativity
text: sigma statistical coefficient. n number rows/columns confusion matrix. m sum confusion matrix elements. set NULL, function estimate \(\sigma\)-significativity \(c\) \(\mathcal{P}_{n}\) (default: NULL). number_of_samples number samples used evaluate significativity using Monte Carlo method (default: 10000).

title: The \(\sigma\)-significativity of \(c\) — significativity
text: m natural number, function returns \(\sigma\)-significativity \(c\) \(\mathcal{M}_{n,m}\). instead m set NULL, \(\sigma\)-significativity \(c\) \(\mathcal{P}_{n}\).

title: The \(\sigma\)-significativity of \(c\) — significativity
code: # evaluate kappa-significativity of 0.5 in M_{2,5} with 10000 samples significativity(cohen_kappa, 0.5, 2, 5) #> [1] 0.5761  # evaluate kappa-significativity of 0.5 in M_{2,5} with 1000 samples significativity(cohen_kappa, 0.5, 2, 5, number_of_samples = 1000) #> [1] 0.565  # exactly compute kappa-significativity of 0.5 in M_{2,5} significativity(cohen_kappa, 0.5, 2, 5, number_of_samples = NULL) #> [1] 0.5714286  # evaluate kappa-significativity of 0.5 in P_{2} with 1000 samples significativity(cohen_kappa, 0.5, 2, number_of_samples = 1000) #> [1] 0.887  # evaluate kappa-significativity of 0.5 in P_{2} with 10000 samples significativity(cohen_kappa, 0.5, 2) #> [1] 0.8957  # successive calls to Monte Carlo methods may produce different results significativity(cohen_kappa, 0.5, 2) #> [1] 0.8979  # setting the random seed before the call guarantee repeatability set.seed(1) significativity(cohen_kappa, 0.5, 2) #> [1] 0.9012  set.seed(1) significativity(cohen_kappa, 0.5, 2) #> [1] 0.9012
